com.vmware.vcenter.confidential_computing.sgx

Interface Hosts

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, HostsTypes, com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HostsStub

    public interface Hosts
extends com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, HostsTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Hosts interfaces provides methods to register Intel Software Guard Extensions (SGX) for the hosts. This interface was added in vSphere API 8.0.0.1.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Hosts.RegisterInvocation
      TaskInvocable that represents the Hosts#register vAPI operation.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.vcenter.confidential_computing.sgx.HostsTypes

        HostsTypes._VAPI_OPERATIONS, HostsTypes.RegisterSpec

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.vmware.vcenter.confidential_computing.sgx.HostsTypes

        _VAPI_SERVICE_ID

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Hosts.RegisterInvocation register(HostsTypes.RegisterSpec spec)
      Register host by stored SGX configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        Hosts.RegisterInvocation register(HostsTypes.RegisterSpec spec)
        Register host by stored SGX configuration. This method was added in vSphere API 8.0.0.1.
        Parameters:
        spec - Described the host that need to be registered.
        Returns:
        instance of Hosts.RegisterInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described register operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - for any other error.
        NotFound - if the host ID is not valid.
        ResourceBusy - if register for same host is already in progress.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unsupported - if the system does not support SGX Registration.
